blocks.name: getUserInfo
blocks.description: Return the information about the API-connected user

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: validateApiKey
blocks.description: Validate an API key and respond to a ping

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: getSenders
blocks.description: Return the senders that have tried to use this account, both verified and unverified

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: sendTransactionalMessage
blocks.description: Send a new transactional message through Mandrill

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: messageHtml
args.info: The full HTML content to be sent

args.name: messageText
args.info: Optional full text content to be sent

args.name: messageSubject
args.info: The message subject

args.name: messageFromEmail
args.info: The sender email address.

args.name: messageFromName
args.info: Optional from name to be used

args.name: messageTo
args.info: An array of recipient information.

args.name: messageHeaders
args.info: Optional extra headers to add to the message (most headers are allowed)

args.name: messageImportant
args.info: Whether or not this message is important, and should be delivered ahead of non-important messages

args.name: messageTrackOpens
args.info: Whether or not to turn on open tracking for the message

args.name: messageTrackClicks
args.info: Whether or not to turn on click tracking for the message

args.name: messageAutoText
args.info: Whether or not to automatically generate a text part for messages that are not given text

args.name: messageAutoHtml
args.info: Whether or not to automatically generate an HTML part for messages that are not given HTML

args.name: messageInlineCss
args.info: Whether or not to automatically inline all CSS styles provided in the message HTML - only for HTML documents less than 256KB in size

args.name: messageUseStripQs
args.info: Whether or not to strip the query string from URLs when aggregating tracked URL data

args.name: messagePreserveRecipients
args.info: Whether or not to expose all recipients in to "To" header for each email

args.name: messageViewContentLink
args.info: Whether or not to remove content logging for sensitive emails

args.name: messageBccAddress
args.info: An optional address to receive an exact copy of each recipient's email

args.name: messageTrackingDomain
args.info: A custom domain to use for tracking opens and clicks instead of mandrillapp.com

args.name: messageSigningDomain
args.info: A custom domain to use for SPF/DKIM signing instead of mandrill (for "via" or "on behalf of" in email clients)

args.name: messageReturnPathDomain
args.info: A custom domain to use for the messages's return-path

args.name: messageMerge
args.info: Whether to evaluate merge tags in the message. Will automatically be set to true if either messageMergeVars or messageGlobalMergeVars are provided.

args.name: messageMergeLanguage
args.info: The merge tag language to use when evaluating merge tags, either mailchimp or handlebars

args.name: messageGlobalMergeVars
args.info: Global merge variables to use for all recipients. You can override these per recipient.

args.name: messageMergeVars
args.info: Per-recipient merge variables, which override global merge variables with the same name.

args.name: messageTags
args.info: An array of string to tag the message with. Stats are accumulated using tags, though we only store the first 100 we see, so this should not be unique or change frequently. Tags should be 50 characters or less. Any tags starting with an underscore are reserved for internal use and will cause errors.

args.name: messageSubaccount
args.info: The unique id of a subaccount for this message - must already exist or will fail with an error

args.name: messageGoogleAnalyticsDomains
args.info: An array of strings indicating for which any matching URLs will automatically have Google Analytics parameters appended to their query string automatically.

args.name: messageGoogleAnalyticsCampaign
args.info: String indicating the value to set for the utm_campaign tracking parameter. If this isn't provided the email's from address will be used instead.

args.name: messageMetadata
args.info: Metadata an associative array of user metadata. Mandrill will store this metadata and make it available for retrieval. In addition, you can select up to 10 metadata fields to index and make searchable using the Mandrill search api.

args.name: messageRecipientMetadata
args.info: Per-recipient metadata that will override the global values specified in the metadata parameter.

args.name: messageAttachments
args.info: An array of supported attachments to add to the message

args.name: messageImages
args.info: An array of embedded images to add to the message

args.name: async
args.info: Enable a background sending mode that is optimized for bulk sending. In async mode, messages/send will immediately return a status of "queued" for every recipient. To handle rejections when sending in async mode, set up a webhook for the 'reject' event. Defaults to false for messages with no more than 10 recipients; messages with more than 10 recipients are always sent asynchronously, regardless of the value of async.

args.name: ipPool
args.info: The name of the dedicated ip pool that should be used to send the message. If you do not have any dedicated IPs, this parameter has no effect. If you specify a pool that does not exist, your default pool will be used instead.

args.name: sendAt
args.info: When this message should be sent as a UTC timestamp in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If you specify a time in the past, the message will be sent immediately. An additional fee applies for scheduled email, and this feature is only available to accounts with a positive balance.

blocks.name: sendTemplateTransactionalMessage
blocks.description: Send a new transactional message through Mandrill using a template

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: messageHtml
args.info: The full HTML content to be sent

args.name: templateName
args.info: The immutable name or slug of a template that exists in the user's account. For backwards-compatibility, the template name may also be used but the immutable slug is preferred.

args.name: templateContent
args.info: An array of template content to send. Each item in the array should be a struct with two keys - name: the name of the content block to set the content for, and content: the actual content to put into the block

args.name: messageText
args.info: Optional full text content to be sent

args.name: messageSubject
args.info: The message subject

args.name: messageFromEmail
args.info: The sender email address.

args.name: messageFromName
args.info: Optional from name to be used

args.name: messageTo
args.info: An array of recipient information.

args.name: messageHeaders
args.info: Optional extra headers to add to the message (most headers are allowed)

args.name: messageImportant
args.info: Whether or not this message is important, and should be delivered ahead of non-important messages

args.name: messageTrackOpens
args.info: Whether or not to turn on open tracking for the message

args.name: messageTrackClicks
args.info: Whether or not to turn on click tracking for the message

args.name: messageAutoText
args.info: Whether or not to automatically generate a text part for messages that are not given text

args.name: messageAutoHtml
args.info: Whether or not to automatically generate an HTML part for messages that are not given HTML

args.name: messageInlineCss
args.info: Whether or not to automatically inline all CSS styles provided in the message HTML - only for HTML documents less than 256KB in size

args.name: messageUseStripQs
args.info: Whether or not to strip the query string from URLs when aggregating tracked URL data

args.name: messagePreserveRecipients
args.info: Whether or not to expose all recipients in to "To" header for each email

args.name: messageViewContentLink
args.info: Whether or not to remove content logging for sensitive emails

args.name: messageBccAddress
args.info: An optional address to receive an exact copy of each recipient's email

args.name: messageTrackingDomain
args.info: A custom domain to use for tracking opens and clicks instead of mandrillapp.com

args.name: messageSigningDomain
args.info: A custom domain to use for SPF/DKIM signing instead of mandrill (for "via" or "on behalf of" in email clients)

args.name: messageReturnPathDomain
args.info: A custom domain to use for the messages's return-path

args.name: messageMerge
args.info: Whether to evaluate merge tags in the message. Will automatically be set to true if either messageMergeVars or messageGlobalMergeVars are provided.

args.name: messageMergeLanguage
args.info: The merge tag language to use when evaluating merge tags, either mailchimp or handlebars

args.name: messageGlobalMergeVars
args.info: Global merge variables to use for all recipients. You can override these per recipient.

args.name: messageMergeVars
args.info: Per-recipient merge variables, which override global merge variables with the same name.

args.name: messageTags
args.info: An array of string to tag the message with. Stats are accumulated using tags, though we only store the first 100 we see, so this should not be unique or change frequently. Tags should be 50 characters or less. Any tags starting with an underscore are reserved for internal use and will cause errors.

args.name: messageSubaccount
args.info: The unique id of a subaccount for this message - must already exist or will fail with an error

args.name: messageGoogleAnalyticsDomains
args.info: An array of strings indicating for which any matching URLs will automatically have Google Analytics parameters appended to their query string automatically.

args.name: messageGoogleAnalyticsCampaign
args.info: String indicating the value to set for the utm_campaign tracking parameter. If this isn't provided the email's from address will be used instead.

args.name: messageMetadata
args.info: Metadata an associative array of user metadata. Mandrill will store this metadata and make it available for retrieval. In addition, you can select up to 10 metadata fields to index and make searchable using the Mandrill search api.

args.name: messageRecipientMetadata
args.info: Per-recipient metadata that will override the global values specified in the metadata parameter.

args.name: messageAttachments
args.info: An array of supported attachments to add to the message

args.name: messageImages
args.info: An array of embedded images to add to the message

args.name: async
args.info: Enable a background sending mode that is optimized for bulk sending. In async mode, messages/send will immediately return a status of "queued" for every recipient. To handle rejections when sending in async mode, set up a webhook for the 'reject' event. Defaults to false for messages with no more than 10 recipients; messages with more than 10 recipients are always sent asynchronously, regardless of the value of async.

args.name: ipPool
args.info: The name of the dedicated ip pool that should be used to send the message. If you do not have any dedicated IPs, this parameter has no effect. If you specify a pool that does not exist, your default pool will be used instead.

args.name: sendAt
args.info: When this message should be sent as a UTC timestamp in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If you specify a time in the past, the message will be sent immediately. An additional fee applies for scheduled email, and this feature is only available to accounts with a positive balance.

blocks.name: searchMessages
blocks.description: Search recently sent messages and optionally narrow by date range, tags, senders, and API keys.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: query
args.info: Search terms to find matching messages

args.name: dateFrom
args.info: Start date

args.name: dateTo
args.info: End date

args.name: tags
args.info: An array of tag names to narrow the search to, will return messages that contain ANY of the tags

args.name: senders
args.info: An array of sender addresses to narrow the search to, will return messages sent by ANY of the senders

args.name: apiKeys
args.info: An array of API keys to narrow the search to, will return messages sent by ANY of the keys

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of results to return, defaults to 100, 1000 is the maximum

blocks.name: searchTimeSeriesMessages
blocks.description: Search the content of recently sent messages and return the aggregated hourly stats for matching messages

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: query
args.info: Search terms to find matching messages

args.name: dateFrom
args.info: Start date

args.name: dateTo
args.info: End date

args.name: tags
args.info: An array of tag names to narrow the search to, will return messages that contain ANY of the tags

args.name: senders
args.info: An array of sender addresses to narrow the search to, will return messages sent by ANY of the senders

blocks.name: getSingleMessage
blocks.description: Get the information for a single recently sent message

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: messageId
args.info: The unique id of the message to get - passed as the "_id" field in webhooks, send calls, or search calls

blocks.name: parseEmailMessage
blocks.description: Parse the full MIME document for an email message, returning the content of the message broken into its constituent pieces

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: rawMessage
args.info: The full MIME document of an email message

blocks.name: sendRawMessage
blocks.description: Take a raw MIME document for a message, and send it exactly as if it were sent through Mandrill's SMTP servers

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: rawMessage
args.info: The full MIME document of an email message

args.name: fromEmail
args.info: Optionally define the sender address - otherwise we'll use the address found in the provided headers

args.name: fromName
args.info: Optionally define the sender alias

args.name: to
args.info: Optionally define the recipients to receive the message - otherwise we'll use the To, Cc, and Bcc headers provided in the document

args.name: async
args.info: Enable a background sending mode that is optimized for bulk sending. In async mode, messages/send will immediately return a status of "queued" for every recipient. To handle rejections when sending in async mode, set up a webhook for the 'reject' event. Defaults to false for messages with no more than 10 recipients; messages with more than 10 recipients are always sent asynchronously, regardless of the value of async.

args.name: ipPool
args.info: The name of the dedicated ip pool that should be used to send the message. If you do not have any dedicated IPs, this parameter has no effect. If you specify a pool that does not exist, your default pool will be used instead.

args.name: sendAt
args.info: When this message should be sent as a UTC timestamp in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If you specify a time in the past, the message will be sent immediately. An additional fee applies for scheduled email, and this feature is only available to accounts with a positive balance.

args.name: returnPathDomain
args.info: A custom domain to use for the messages's return-path

blocks.name: getScheduledEmails
blocks.description: Queries your scheduled emails.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: to
args.info: An optional recipient address to restrict results to

blocks.name: cancelScheduledEmail
blocks.description: Cancels a scheduled email.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: messageId
args.info: A scheduled email id, as returned by any of the messages/send calls or messages/list-scheduled

blocks.name: rescheduleScheduledEmail
blocks.description: Reschedules a scheduled email.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: messageId
args.info: A scheduled email id, as returned by any of the messages/send calls or messages/list-scheduled

args.name: sendAt
args.info: The new UTC timestamp when the message should sent. Mandrill can't time travel, so if you specify a time in past the message will be sent immediately

blocks.name: getUserDefinedTagInfo
blocks.description: Return all of the user-defined tag information

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: deleteTag
blocks.description: Deletes a tag permanently. Deleting a tag removes the tag from any messages that have been sent, and also deletes the tag's stats. There is no way to undo this operation, so use it carefully.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: tag
args.info: Tag name

blocks.name: getSingleTag
blocks.description: Return more detailed information about a single tag, including aggregates of recent stats

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: tag
args.info: Tag name

blocks.name: getTagHistory
blocks.description: Return the recent history (hourly stats for the last 30 days) for a tag

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: tag
args.info: Tag name

blocks.name: getAllTagsHistory
blocks.description: Return the recent history (hourly stats for the last 30 days) for all tags

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: addEmailToRejectionBlacklist
blocks.description: Adds an email to your email rejection blacklist. Addresses that you add manually will never expire and there is no reputation penalty for removing them from your blacklist. Attempting to blacklist an address that has been whitelisted will have no effect.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: email
args.info: Email address to block

args.name: comment
args.info: Optional comment describing the rejection

args.name: subaccount
args.info: Optional unique identifier for the subaccount to limit the blacklist entry

blocks.name: getEmailRejectionBlacklist
blocks.description: Retrieves your email rejection blacklist. You can provide an email address to limit the results. Returns up to 1000 results. By default, entries that have expired are excluded from the results

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: email
args.info: Optional email address to search by

args.name: includeExpired
args.info: Whether to include rejections that have already expired.n

args.name: subaccount
args.info: Optional unique identifier for the subaccount to limit the blacklist entry

blocks.name: deleteEmailRejection
blocks.description: Deletes an email rejection. There is no limit to how many rejections you can remove from your blacklist, but keep in mind that each deletion has an affect on your reputation.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: email
args.info: Email address to block

args.name: subaccount
args.info: Optional unique identifier for the subaccount to limit the blacklist entry

blocks.name: addEmailToRejectionWhitelist
blocks.description: Adds an email to your email rejection whitelist. If the address is currently on your blacklist, that blacklist entry will be removed automatically.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: email
args.info: Email address to block

args.name: comment
args.info: Optional description of why the email was whitelisted

blocks.name: getEmailRejectionWhitelist
blocks.description: Retrieves your email rejection whitelist. You can provide an email address or search prefix to limit the results. Returns up to 1000 results.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: email
args.info: Optional email address to search by

blocks.name: getSenderDomains
blocks.description: Returns the sender domains that have been added to this account.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: addSenderDomain
blocks.description: Adds a sender domain to your account. Sender domains are added automatically as you send, but you can use this call to add them ahead of time.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain name

blocks.name: checkSenderDomain
blocks.description: Checks the SPF and DKIM settings for a domain. If you haven't already added this domain to your account, it will be added automatically.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain name

blocks.name: verifyDomain
blocks.description: Sends a verification email in order to verify ownership of a domain.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain name

args.name: mailbox
args.info: Mailbox at the domain where the verification email should be sent

blocks.name: getSingleSender
blocks.description: Return more detailed information about a single sender, including aggregates of recent stats

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: address
args.info: Email address of the sender

blocks.name: getSenderHistory
blocks.description: Return the recent history (hourly stats for the last 30 days) for a sender

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: address
args.info: Email address of the sender

blocks.name: getMostClickedURLs
blocks.description: Get the 100 most clicked URLs

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: searchMostClickedURLs
blocks.description: Return the 100 most clicked URLs that match the search query given

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: query
args.info: Search query

blocks.name: getURLHistory
blocks.description: Return the 100 most clicked URLs that match the search query given

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: url
args.info: Existing URL

blocks.name: getTrackingDomains
blocks.description: Get the list of tracking domains set up for this account

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: addTrackingDomain
blocks.description: Add a tracking domain to your account

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain name

blocks.name: checkTrackingDomain
blocks.description: Checks the CNAME settings for a tracking domain. The domain must have been added already with the add-tracking-domain call.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain name

blocks.name: addTemplate
blocks.description: Add a new template

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: name
args.info: Template name

args.name: fromName
args.info: Default sending address for emails sent using this template

args.name: fromEmail
args.info: Default from name to be used

args.name: subject
args.info: Default subject line to be used

args.name: code
args.info: The HTML code for the template with mc:edit attributes for the editable elements

args.name: text
args.info: Default text part to be used when sending with this template

args.name: publish
args.info: Set to false to add a draft template without publishing

args.name: labels
args.info: An optional array of up to 10 labels to use for filtering templates

blocks.name: updateTemplate
blocks.description: Update existing template

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: name
args.info: Template name

args.name: fromName
args.info: Default sending address for emails sent using this template

args.name: fromEmail
args.info: Default from name to be used

args.name: subject
args.info: Default subject line to be used

args.name: code
args.info: The HTML code for the template with mc:edit attributes for the editable elements

args.name: text
args.info: Default text part to be used when sending with this template

args.name: publish
args.info: Set to false to add a draft template without publishing

args.name: labels
args.info: An optional array of up to 10 labels to use for filtering templates

blocks.name: getTemplateInfo
blocks.description: Get the information for an existing template

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: name
args.info: Template name

blocks.name: publishTemplate
blocks.description: Publish the content for the template. Any new messages sent using this template will start using the content that was previously in draft.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: name
args.info: Template name

blocks.name: getTemplateHistory
blocks.description: Return the recent history (hourly stats for the last 30 days) for a template

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: name
args.info: Template name

blocks.name: renderTemplate
blocks.description: Inject content and optionally merge fields into a template, returning the HTML that results

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: templateName
args.info: Template name

args.name: templateContent
args.info: Array of template content to render. Each item in the array should be a struct with two keys - name: the name of the content block to set the content for, and content: the actual content to put into the block

args.name: mergeVars
args.info: Optional merge variables to use for injecting merge field content. If this is not provided, no merge fields will be replaced

blocks.name: deleteTemplate
blocks.description: Delete a template

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: name
args.info: Template name

blocks.name: getAllWebhooks
blocks.description: Get the list of all webhooks defined on the account

args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: addWebhook
blocks.description: Add a new webhook

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: webhookUrl
args.info: The URL to POST batches of events

args.name: description
args.info: An optional description of the webhook

args.name: events
args.info: An optional list of events that will be posted to the webhook

blocks.name: getSingleWebhook
blocks.description: Given the ID of an existing webhook, return the data about it

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: webhookId
args.info: The unique identifier of a webhook belonging to this account

blocks.name: updateWebhook
blocks.description: Update an existing webhook

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: webhookId
args.info: The unique identifier of a webhook belonging to this account

args.name: webhookUrl
args.info: The URL to POST batches of events

args.name: description
args.info: An optional description of the webhook

args.name: events
args.info: An optional list of events that will be posted to the webhook

blocks.name: deleteWebhook
blocks.description: Delete an existing webhook

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: webhookId
args.info: The unique identifier of a webhook belonging to this account

blocks.name: getSubaccounts
blocks.description: Get the list of subaccounts defined for the account, optionally filtered by a prefix

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: query
args.info: An optional prefix to filter the subaccounts' ids and names

blocks.name: addSubaccount
blocks.description: Add a new subaccount

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: subaccountId
args.info: A unique identifier for the subaccount to be used in sending calls

args.name: subaccountName
args.info: An optional display name to further identify the subaccount

args.name: subaccountNotes
args.info: An optional extra text to associate with the subaccount

args.name: subaccountCustomQuota
args.info: An optional manual hourly quota for the subaccount. If not specified, Mandrill will manage this based on reputation

blocks.name: getSingleSubaccount
blocks.description: Given the ID of an existing subaccount, return the data about it

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: subaccountId
args.info: A unique identifier for the subaccount to be used in sending calls

blocks.name: updateSubaccount
blocks.description: Update an existing subaccount

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: subaccountId
args.info: A unique identifier of the subaccount to update

args.name: subaccountName
args.info: An optional display name to further identify the subaccount

args.name: subaccountNotes
args.info: An optional extra text to associate with the subaccount

args.name: subaccountCustomQuota
args.info: An optional manual hourly quota for the subaccount. If not specified, Mandrill will manage this based on reputation

blocks.name: pauseSubaccountSending
blocks.description: Pause a subaccount's sending. Any future emails delivered to this subaccount will be queued for a maximum of 3 days until the subaccount is resumed.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: subaccountId
args.info: A unique identifier of the subaccount

blocks.name: resumeSubaccountSending
blocks.description: Resume a paused subaccount's sending

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: subaccountId
args.info: A unique identifier of the subaccount

blocks.name: deleteSubaccount
blocks.description: Delete an existing subaccount. Any email related to the subaccount will be saved, but stats will be removed and any future sending calls to this subaccount will fail.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: subaccountId
args.info: A unique identifier of the subaccount

blocks.name: getInboundDomains
blocks.description: List the domains that have been configured for inbound delivery.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: addInboundDomain
blocks.description: Add an inbound domain to your account

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain name

blocks.name: checkInboundDomain
blocks.description: Check the MX settings for an inbound domain. The domain must have already been added with the add-domain call

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain name

blocks.name: getInboundMailboxRoutes
blocks.description: List the mailbox routes defined for an inbound domain

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain name

blocks.name: addInboundMailboxRoute
blocks.description: Add a new mailbox route to an inbound domain

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain name

args.name: pattern
args.info: The search pattern that the mailbox name should match

args.name: routeUrl
args.info: The webhook URL where the inbound messages will be published

blocks.name: updateInboundMailboxRoute
blocks.description: Update the pattern or webhook of an existing inbound mailbox route. If null is provided for any fields, the values will remain unchanged.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: routeId
args.info: Id of the route

args.name: pattern
args.info: The search pattern that the mailbox name should match

args.name: routeUrl
args.info: The webhook URL where the inbound messages will be published

blocks.name: deleteInboundMailboxRoute
blocks.description: Delete an existing inbound mailbox route

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: routeId
args.info: Id of the route

blocks.name: deleteInboundMailboxRoute
blocks.description: Delete an existing inbound mailbox route

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: routeId
args.info: Id of the route

blocks.name: sendInboundRaw
blocks.description: Take a raw MIME document destined for a domain with inbound domains set up, and send it to the inbound hook exactly as if it had been sent over SMTP

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: rawMessage
args.info: The full MIME document of an email message

args.name: to
args.info: Optionally define the recipients to receive the message - otherwise we'll use the To, Cc, and Bcc headers provided in the document

args.name: fromEmail
args.info: The address specified in the MAIL FROM stage of the SMTP conversation. Required for the SPF check.

args.name: helo
args.info: The identification provided by the client mta in the MTA state of the SMTP conversation. Required for the SPF check.

args.name: clientAddress
args.info: The remote MTA's ip address. Optional; required for the SPF check.

blocks.name: deleteInboundDomain
blocks.description: Delete an inbound domain from the account. All mail will stop routing for this domain immediately.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain name

blocks.name: getAllExports
blocks.description: Returns a list of your exports.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: startRejectionBlacklistExport
blocks.description: Begins an export of your rejection blacklist. The blacklist will be exported to a zip archive containing a single file named rejects.csv that includes the following fields: email, reason, detail, created_at, expires_at, last_event_at, expires_at.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: notifyEmail
args.info: An optional email address to notify when the export job has finished.

blocks.name: getExportJob
blocks.description: Returns information about an export job. If the export job's state is 'complete', the returned data will include a URL you can use to fetch the results.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: exportJobId
args.info: Export job identifier

blocks.name: startRejectionWhitelistExport
blocks.description: Begins an export of your rejection whitelist. The whitelist will be exported to a zip archive containing a single file named whitelist.csv that includes the following fields: email, detail, created_at.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: notifyEmail
args.info: An optional email address to notify when the export job has finished.

blocks.name: startActivityHistoryExport
blocks.description: Begins an export of your activity history. The activity will be exported to a zip archive containing a single file named activity.csv in the same format as you would be able to export from your account's activity view. It includes the following fields: Date, Email Address, Sender, Subject, Status, Tags, Opens, Clicks, Bounce Detail. If you have configured any custom metadata fields, they will be included in the exported data.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: notifyEmail
args.info: An optional email address to notify when the export job has finished.

args.name: dateFrom
args.info: Start date as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

args.name: dateTo
args.info: End date as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

args.name: tags
args.info: An array of tag names to narrow the export to; will match messages that contain ANY of the tags

args.name: senders
args.info: An array of senders to narrow the export to

args.name: states
args.info: An array of states to narrow the export to; messages with ANY of the states will be included (sent, rejected, bounced, soft-bounced, spam, unsub)

args.name: apiKeys
args.info: An array of api keys to narrow the export to; messsagse sent with ANY of the keys will be included

blocks.name: getMyDedicatedIPs
blocks.description: Lists your dedicated IPs.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: getSingleDedicatedIP
blocks.description: Retrieves information about a single dedicated ip.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: ipAddress
args.info: Dedicated IP address

blocks.name: requestDedicatedIP
blocks.description: Requests an additional dedicated IP for your account. Accounts may have one outstanding request at any time, and provisioning requests are processed within 24 hours.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: warmup
args.info: Whether to enable warmup mode for the ip

args.name: pool
args.info: The id of the pool to add the dedicated ip to, or null to use your account's default pool

blocks.name: startWarmupForDedicatedIP
blocks.description: Begins the warmup process for a dedicated IP. During the warmup process, Mandrill will gradually increase the percentage of your mail that is sent over the warming-up IP, over a period of roughly 30 days. The rest of your mail will be sent over shared IPs or other dedicated IPs in the same pool.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: ipAddress
args.info: Dedicated IP address

blocks.name: cancelWarmupForDedicatedIP
blocks.description: Cancels the warmup process for a dedicated IP.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: ipAddress
args.info: Dedicated IP address

blocks.name: movesDedicatedIP
blocks.description: Moves a dedicated IP to a different pool.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: ipAddress
args.info: Dedicated IP address

args.name: addressPool
args.info: Name of the new pool to add the dedicated ip to

args.name: createPool
args.info: Whether to create the pool if it does not exist; if false and the pool does not exist, an Unknown_Pool will be thrown.

blocks.name: deleteDedicatedIP
blocks.description: Deletes a dedicated IP. This is permanent and cannot be undone.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: ipAddress
args.info: Dedicated IP address

blocks.name: getMyDedicatedIpPools
blocks.description: Lists your dedicated IP pools.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

blocks.name: createPool
blocks.description: Creates a pool and returns it. If a pool already exists with this name, no action will be performed.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: poolName
args.info: Name of a pool to create

blocks.name: getSingleDedicatedIpPool
blocks.description: Describes a single dedicated IP pool.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: poolName
args.info: Name of a pool

blocks.name: deletePool
blocks.description: Deletes a pool. A pool must be empty before you can delete it, and you cannot delete your default pool.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Mandrill

args.name: poolName
args.info: Name of a pool
